Yes, there are plenty of opportunities for students who are new to sports and want to learn and develop their skills at Queen's University Belfast. The university offers a range of programs, clubs, and events to accommodate students at all levels of ability, including those who have little or no experience in sports.

For example, Queen's Sport, the university's sports and leisure service, provides a variety of classes, courses, and workshops, including beginner-level programs in activities such as yoga, pilates, swimming, and aerobics. These classes are designed to help students develop the fundamental skills and knowledge required to participate in the more advanced-level activities.

Additionally, many of the university's sports clubs and societies welcome beginners and provide coaching, mentorship, and support to help them develop their skills and knowledge. These clubs also offer opportunities for students to compete in a range of local, regional, and national competitions.

Overall, Queen's University Belfast offers an inclusive and supportive environment for students who are new to sports and want to learn and develop their skills.
